item.text: Is this encounter an inpatient hospital stay?
Was blood gas study ordered and evaluated?
Date of Blood Gas Study test?
Is there an expectation that home oxygen therapy will improve O2 Saturation?
Is the patient mobile within the home?
Does the patient have any conditions that could cause inaccuracies in the ABG/pulse oximetry results?

valueCoding.display: Lives in or travels to high altitude

item.text: Does patient have symptoms of Hypoxemia ?
Was exercise testing performed in-person by a treating practitioner or other medical professional qualified to conduct testing ?
Does the patient have Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) and was it tested during sleep?
Was nocturnal testing performed under the direction of medicare enrolled IDTF ?
Is the patient's OSA being sufficiently treated?
Was the titration study performed after determining optimal settings of the PAP device ?
Arterial oxygen saturation results at rest
Oxygen saturation results during exercise without oxygen
Arterial PO2 results during exercise without oxygen
Oxygen saturation results during exercise with oxygen
Oxygen PO2 results during exercise with oxygen
Study performed in relevance to Nocturnal Restlessness

valueCoding.code: Dependent edema suggesting congestive heart failure?
valueCoding.display: Dependent edema suggesting congestive heart failure?

item.text: For normoxemic patients, are there any medical condition with distinct physiologic, cognitive, and/or functional symptoms documented in high-quality, peer-reviewed literature to be improved by oxygen therapy, such as cluster headaches ?
Does the patient suffer from any of the following conditions ?

valueCoding.display: Angina pectoris in the absence of hypoxemia.
Dyspnea without cor pulmonale or evidence of hypoxemia
Severe peripheral vascular disease resulting in clinically evident desaturation in one or more extremities but in the absence of systemic hypoxemia.
Terminal illnesses that do not affect the ability to breathe
